DataElement.preferredName: Patient Inadequate Control Hypertension Exclusion Criteria Ind-2
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator related to patient's exclusion from participation based on inadequate controlled pathological increase in blood pressure.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Inadequate Control Hypertension Exclusion Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to patient's exclusion from participation based on inadequate controlled pathological increase in blood pressure.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredDefinition: Not meeting a quantitative or qualitative measure necessary for a requirement.:The act of directing or determining; regulation or maintenance of a function or action; a relation of constraint of one entity (thing or person or group) by another.:Pathological increase in blood pressure; a repeatedly elevated blood pressure exceeding 140 over 90 mmHg.:Exclusion; the act of restricting entrance or barring from participation.

Concepts.definition: Not meeting a quantitative or qualitative measure necessary for a requirement.
The act of directing or determining; regulation or maintenance of a function or action; a relation of constraint of one entity (thing or person or group) by another.
Blood pressure that is abnormally high.
Medical and/or social characteristics that prevent a subject from being allowed to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

DataElementConcept.origin: NCCTG CRF:North Central Cancer Treatment Group Case Report Form

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.3.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Changed Workflow Status DBW 04-27-2016

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 8/29/17 tt added CSI per Round 5 finalization task. 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. jk

ReferenceDocuments.name: Inadequately controlled hyper
ReferenceDocuments.description: Inadequately controlled hypertension (systolic blood pressure of >150 mmHg or diastolic pressure >100 mmHg on anti-hypertensive medication)

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a blood pressure (BP) greater than 140 mmHg (systolic) and 90 mmHg (diastolic)

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have uncontrolled hypertension defined as systolic greater than 140 mm Hg or diastolic greater than 90 mm Hg despite anti-hypertensive therapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have uncontrolled hypertension defined as systolic greater than 150 mm Hg or diastolic greater than 90 mm Hg despite anti-hypertensive therapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRf Text5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have uncontrolled hypertension defined as systolic greater than or equal to 150 mm Hg or diastolic greater than or equal to 90 mm Hg despite anti-hypertensive therapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_CRF Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have treatment-refractory hypertension defined as systolic greater than 140 mm Hg or diastolic greater than 90 mm Hg despite anti-hypertensive therapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_CRF Text2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have poorly controlled hypertension defined as systolic blood pressure of greater than or equal to 140 mm Hg or diastolic blood pressure of greater than or equal to 90 mm Hg?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF_Text_6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have systolic blood pressure < 150mmHg and/or diastolic blood pressure < 90mmHg at study entry?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_CRF text 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a blood pressure with systolic BP ≥ 160 mm Hg or diastolic BP ≥ 100 mm Hg

ReferenceDocuments.name: ABTC 1802 Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have uncontrolled hypertension defined as systolic >= 150 mm Hg or diastolic >= 100 mm Hg despite anti-hypertensive therapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG-TEXT-1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did patient have hypertension >99th percentile for age (<18 y) or 140/90 mm Hg (>18 y) or needing ≥2 antihypertensive medications?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did patient have hypertension greater than 99th percentile for age (less than 18 y) or 140/90 mm Hg (greater than 18 y) or needing greater than or equal to 2 antihypertensive medications?

DataElement.origin: NCCTG CRF:North Central Cancer Treatment Group Case Report Form
DataElement.changeDescription: Replaced VD Eligibility Ind-2 2018257v1 with VD ID#3506068 - Yes No Indicator - dbw
